intro: Fimbristylis phaeoleuca, commonly known as the pale-leaved flatsedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia and is often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
